name: chicagotribune
text: Many Chicagoans are scrambling to get their prescriptions filled after at least 60 pharmacies sustained damage or closed in recent days amid unrest over the death of George Floyd. The problem is particularly acute on the city's South Side. https://t.co/SlzWf7lTfx

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @chitribopinions: Can the Chicago Police Department carry out widespread cultural change in 90 days? No. The legacy of abuse is too deeply ingrained to wash away in three months. But Mayor Lightfoot is right when she says the pace of reform has been unacceptably slow. https://t.co/pmD6bBkl44

name: chicagotribune
text: Video that family members say shows a Chicago police officer restraining a woman by kneeling on her neck during a dramatic arrest was recorded Sunday outside a local mall. https://t.co/KcIiwtnNUT

name: chicagotribune
text: In an extraordinary rebuke, former defense secretary Jim Mattis denounced President Trump's use of military force to quell protests, saying his former boss “does not even pretend to try" to unite Americans. https://t.co/zM1Zgqmapw

name: chicagotribune
text: It was a mixed turnout for Chicago restaurants and bars on the first day of the city's eased coronavirus restrictions. https://t.co/ZvBRaooyEa

name: chicagotribune
text: Peeking out from behind plywood, some Chicago stores and restaurants cautiously opened to customers for the first time in months on Wednesday. But many others remained shuttered. https://t.co/Xl2qJbiMOY

name: chicagotribune
text:
Instead of more cop shows, what if television networks greenlit shows that explored a future without police?

Commentary from Tribune entertainment reporter @Nina_Metz: https://t.co/SgM6lBTNbi

name: chicagotribune
text: A man is in police custody after a woman posted a video on social media of what she alleged was a racial insult that led to a physical altercation outside a River Forest grocery store. https://t.co/mhJWQcFbxP

name: chicagotribune
text: Three local pastors have called for Joliet's mayor to resign in the wake of a skirmish between the mayor, who is white, and an African American protester that was captured on video. https://t.co/yYH9y8eFmq

name: chicagotribune
text: "This is a step back." Latino activists speak out about racial tension with black Chicagoans on the Southwest Side amid fallout from the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/v31omHv25v

name: chicagotribune
text: "El sistema es corrupto y quieren ver a las minorías pelearse entre sí para debilitarnos", dijo la activista Montserrat Ayala, quien ayudó a organizar una protesta. "Necesitamos trabajar juntos para desmantelar el racismo". https://t.co/SXahaVBh8f

name: chicagotribune
text: Fact check: President Trump said authorities did not use tear gas against demonstrators outside the White House. There’s evidence they did. https://t.co/Wu818s3lEM

name: chicagotribune
text: President Trump has tried his best to widen the divide between black and white Americans. But he has inadvertently prodded them into a new unity for racial justice, writes columnist @SteveChapman13. https://t.co/Lq6w7I9wGA

name: chicagotribune
text: A man was in custody Wednesday night after leading Chicago police on a chase throughout the city for about an hour, leaving several people, including officers, injured. https://t.co/gaDPHPI941

name: chicagotribune
text: “I realized the only wrong thing to say is to say nothing, because George Floyd’s life mattered,” the former Meghan Markle told students at her former high school. https://t.co/Mir61HoBrt
